result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Veronique J Johnson

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 26, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

3:25 PM Defendant Veronique J Johnson not in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Veronique J Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense states that the Defendant has been unable to get a ride to court today. Defense requests to set a plea/sentencing hearing. 
State requests that the court issue and stay a capias. 
Court will issue and stay a capias, and set case for plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 3, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

03:53 PM Defendant Veronique J Johnson in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Based upon the Defendant's appearance today, the Court will quash the stayed warrant. 

Atty Klein has discovery and an offer, and requests for more time to engage in pre-trial discussions. Court sets.  Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Jessica A Klein in court.   
Defendant Veronique J Johnson did not appear.   
Case scheduled for 2 pm. and Matter called @ 4:14 pm.

Defense is requesting the court stay a warrant.
Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.
  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:37 AM Defendant Veronique J Johnson in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Attorney Jessica Klein has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Preliminary hearing on June 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with co defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint except through counsel.  Defendant is not to have contact with any Kohl's Department store.

02:36 PM Defendant Veronique J Johnson in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
